intro: Hydnocarpus kurzii f. latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf hydnocarpus, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Sapindaceae. It is characterized by its large, elliptical leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in length. The plant produces woody fruits that contain a single, hard seed, which is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in humid, lowland forests and is native to Southeast Asia. Due to its unique morphology and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and pharmacologists alike.
